channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 26
item.description:
April 26, 2020 8:35 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Sunday, April 26.

item.title: Singaporean does her bit educating children about social impact of Covid-19 and kick out racism
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

When concerned citizen Rahimah A. Rahim heard about landlords evicting tenants based on nationality, and of fear-mongering by some that Chinese nationals should be avoided amid the coronavirus outbreak, she did something about it.

item.title: 20 countries sign pact to keep ports open for trade
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Port authorities in 20 countries across three continents have signed an agreement to keep ports open for trade amid the corona-virus pandemic, in a move initiated by Singapore.

item.title: Coronavirus: Smaller crowds at parks, markets after tighter measures
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Markets and parks saw smaller crowds yesterday - the first weekend after tougher circuit breaker measures were imposed - with most people shopping or exercising on their own or in pairs.

item.title: Hosting a 'watch party' to give film lovers, local distributors a boost during Covid-19 circuit breaker phase
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Around 11pm on April 4, about 600 people tuned in to an Instagram live video, co-hosted by writer Amanda Lee Koe and film-maker Kirsten Tan, of a discussion of Portrait Of A Lady On Fire, written and directed by Celine Sciamma.

item.title: 'We don't want to do just plain vanilla deals'
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Like many in the real estate business, KOP has been having a bumpy ride because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Two drivers caught carpooling; vehicles seized
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Two drivers who allegedly provided carpooling services during the circuit breaker period have had their vehicles seized, the Land Transport Authority (LTA) said yesterday.

item.title: Making YouTube videos to engage son and educate others
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Between trying their best to stay positive while cooped up at home and missing their friends, Dr Mani Chugh and Dr Gaurav Chugh found time to give their only child his digital debut.

item.title: Are precautions taken by home delivery services in S'pore enough to ensure they don't spread virus?
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

With dining-in not allowed, many have turned to food delivery services. The Sunday Times looks at measures in place to ensure the booming business does not become a weak link in the fight against Covid-19.

item.title: Nine new coronavirus cases in the community
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of new daily Covid-19 cases in the community has dropped to a single digit for the first time this month, with the average number of new daily cases in the community also dipping - signs that the circuit breaker measures are starting to pay off.

item.title: Businesses affected, but bosses step up to help foreign workers
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Sales at Liang Food Caterer have plunged by around 80 per cent in recent weeks but general manager Foo Zhi Yang is still lending a hand to the community by dishing up meals for migrant workers.

item.title: Heroes made at home
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Having to stay in has not stopped them from helping others.

item.title: Coronavirus: Delivery riders in Singapore taking precautions, but worry about earnings
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Food delivery rider Clare Tan has been working on an almost daily basis since last September but her daily routine has changed significantly in recent weeks.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore sings beloved national tune Home to thank front-line, migrant workers
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Thousands of people joined an islandwide singalong to belt out the well-loved tune Home last night in an effort to thank front-line and migrant workers.

item.title: Sector booms in a time of coronavirus
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Demand for food delivery services has increased by about 20 to 30 per cent since a ban on dining-in kicked in on April 7. Besides customers, new food and beverage operators and workers have also been flocking to the sector.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore Airlines extends flight cancellations by another month
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) has extended its wide-ranging flight cancellations by another month, just four days after it announced a one-month extension.

item.title: Coronavirus: Food delivery firms take steps to guard against infections
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

At least four GrabFood delivery riders have been suspended and more than a hundred others warned for failing to comply with safe distancing rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: Amended rules allow people to fly national flag from now till Sept 30
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

The rules for displaying the national flag have been amended so people can fly it from now until September.

item.title: Coronavirus: From delivery crew to chefs, zi char stall owner plays it safe
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

At hawker stall Hai Yan BBQ Seafood, delivery crew wait patiently several metres from the stall for their orders to be ready.

item.title: Scientists, activists taking their outreach efforts online
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Nature walks and science talks may not be on the cards during the circuit breaker, but scientists and activists are taking their efforts online, offering free activities for people at home. The organisers say these help people feel less isolated, and engaged on important issues.

item.title: Staggered breaks, less chatter as F&B firms in Singapore take precautions against coronavirus
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Food and beverage outlets are taking every precaution - from staggered lunch breaks and frequent hand washing to cutting down on chatter - to keep staff and customers safe from Covid-19.

item.title: Changing face of funerals amid Covid-19 circuit breaker rules
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

As the elderly woman grieved for her husband, she muttered under her breath: "Why don't we have fu qi (good fortune)? Why does my husband have to die at the wrong time?"

item.title: 'Thank you' posters for delivery riders amid Covid-19 circuit breaker period
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

With the circuit breaker measures, those who deliver food to residences have taken on an outsized importance - and Mr Pann Lim and his colleagues have put their design skills to work to make sure this group of essential workers know they are appreciated.

item.title: More terminally ill patients staying at home or in hospice, not hospitals
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

More people are spending their last days at home or in hospices instead of hospitals, in part because of the bed crunch and fear of coronavirus infection, say two hospices.

item.title: Recovered patients may not be immune to Covid-19: WHO
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

In Singapore, overall infection figures need to fall consistently for a few days before one can safely say that it is on a surer footing in containing the situation, says infectious diseases expert Dr Leong Hoe Nam.

item.title: Students launch website to help users order directly from hawkers during Covid-19 circuit breaker period
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Two university students noticed hawkers struggling to cope with the circuit breaker measures and decided that the stalls needed a boost online.

item.title: Otters play in streets as they look for new home
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

As the country enters the third week of its circuit breaker period and with most people cooped up at home, animal residents unbound by safe distancing rules are taking this opportunity to explore urban spaces now empty of humans, as they have never been able to do before.

item.title: Coronavirus: Tough decision had to be made to shut down work sites quickly
item.description:
April 26, 2020 5:00 AM

The Republic had to make a hard decision and suspend all construction work as part of tighter measures that kicked in last Wednesday.
